meanings.definition: To integrate again into a whole
meanings.sent1: After being away for a year, she needed to reintegrate into her old school.
meanings.sent2: The team worked together to reintegrate the missing pieces of the puzzle.
meanings.sent3: Trying to reintegrate the jigsaw puzzle without looking at the picture was a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: The artist decided to reintegrate different art styles into a unique masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to reintegrate the separated ingredients to create a delicious dish.

meanings.sent1: The teacher had to reintegrate the students after recess.
meanings.sent2: The family reunion was a great opportunity to reintegrate distant relatives.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to reintegrate the torn pieces of paper back together.
meanings.sent4: The community worked together to reintegrate the divided neighborhoods.
meanings.sent5: The coach needed to reintegrate the players to form a strong team.

meanings.definition: To restore to a unified state
meanings.sent1: The therapist helped the patient reintegrate their thoughts and emotions.
meanings.sent2: The peace treaty aimed to reintegrate the warring factions into a peaceful society.
meanings.sent3: The repairman had to reintegrate the broken parts of the machine to make it work again.
meanings.sent4: The leader's goal was to reintegrate the diverse community into a harmonious group.
meanings.sent5: The architect had to reintegrate the old building with the modern design seamlessly.
